title: swagger generate server with `-t` leads to non-compiliable generated code

milestone.title: Minimal first release
milestone.description:
This first release is focussed on getting a baseline in functionality set.

It should however promise API stability to support the entire planned feature set:

Baseline functionality: 

* validate a spec, including extended validations
* generate a client from a spec
* generate a spec through go code analysis
* generate a server from a spec

API stability:

* serialization format agnostic
* transport agnostic, this should be a matter of config
* validation for client and server

body:
Code is generated in the wrong directory if `-t` is passed to generate server.

steps to reproduce:

swagger-v2.yml

``` yaml
swagger: '2.0'
info:
  version: '2.0'
  title: Test API

basePath: /api/2.0/
schemes:
  - https
consumes:
  - application/json
produces:
  - application/json
paths:
  '/sample/action/do-something':
    post:
      operationId: sampleDoSomethingAction
      parameters:
        - name: json body
          in: body
          required: true
          schema:
            $ref: "#/definitions/Actions_DoSomethingRequest"

      responses:
        '200':
          description: Success
          schema:
            $ref: '#/definitions/Actions_DoSomethingResponse'
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
        '404':
          description: Not Found

definitions:
  Actions_DoSomethingRequest:
    type: object
    properties:
      client_id:
        type: string

  Actions_DoSomethingResponse:
    type: object
    properties:
      result:
        type: string
```

which validates:

```
swagger validate swagger-v2.yml
The swagger spec at "swagger-v2.yml" is valid against swagger specification 2.0
```

and generates

```
>swagger generate server -f swagger-v2.yml  -t generated
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered model template: Actions_DoSomethingRequest
2015/12/05 10:38:37 generated model Actions_DoSomethingRequest
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered model template: Actions_DoSomethingResponse
2015/12/05 10:38:37 generated model Actions_DoSomethingResponse
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered handler template: operations.SampleDoSomethingAction
2015/12/05 10:38:37 generated handler operations.SampleDoSomethingAction
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered parameters template: operations.SampleDoSomethingActionParameters
2015/12/05 10:38:37 generated parameters operations.SampleDoSomethingActionParameters
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered responses template: operations.SampleDoSomethingActionResponses
2015/12/05 10:38:37 generated responses operations.SampleDoSomethingActionResponses
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered builder template: operations.TestAPI
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered embedded Swagger JSON template: server.TestAPI
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered configure api template: operations.ConfigureTestAPI
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered doc template: operations.TestAPI
2015/12/05 10:38:37 rendered main template: server.TestAPI
```

but does not build

```
>go build ./...
# x/y/z/generated/restapi/operations
generated/restapi/operations/test_api_api.go:45: undefined: SampleDoSomethingActionHandler
```

note that isn't generated:

```
>git grep -i SampleDoSomethingActionHandler .
>
```

the generated code is as follows, note the restapi folder has generated in it, it is not under generated/.

```
    generated/cmd/test-api-server/configure_test_api.go
    generated/cmd/test-api-server/doc.go
    generated/cmd/test-api-server/embedded_spec.go
    generated/cmd/test-api-server/main.go
    generated/models/actions_do_something_request.go
    generated/models/actions_do_something_response.go
    generated/restapi/operations/test_api_api.go
    restapi/generated/operations/sample_do_something_action.go
    restapi/generated/operations/sample_do_something_action_parameters.go
    restapi/generated/operations/sample_do_something_action_responses.go
```

Move the folders to correct the visibility:

```
mv restapi/generated/operations/sample_do_something_action* generated/restapi/operations/
```

and it works.

regenerate without the `-t generated`, and it works also

```
>swagger generate server -f swagger-v2.yml
>
```

files generated are:

```
    cmd/test-api-server/configure_test_api.go
    cmd/test-api-server/doc.go
    cmd/test-api-server/embedded_spec.go
    cmd/test-api-server/main.go
    models/actions_do_something_request.go
    models/actions_do_something_response.go
    restapi/operations/sample_do_something_action.go
    restapi/operations/sample_do_something_action_parameters.go
    restapi/operations/sample_do_something_action_responses.go
    restapi/operations/test_api_api.go
...

```
